name: Sofitel Miami

reviews.title: Post cruise stay at the Sofitel
reviews.text: I had done a lot of research on Hotels for our pre and post cruise stays while in Miami and decided on the Sofitel for our post cruise night due to its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle. I had booked the hotel around 3 months in advance of our trip and was able to get it for $122 per night by booking thru their website. It was more than I wanted to pay, but was very happy with the hotel.

reviews.title: Contradiction
reviews.text: It is too depressing for me to get off of a cruise ship (the most comfortable bed and pillows EVER) and end our vacation, so I know must stay one night post cruise. Little did I know that this hotel would make me feel like I was still on the ship!!
We debarked around noon and we were to the hotel by 12:30 and checked in. The lobby was beautiful and the doorman/bellman very helpful.
reviews.title: Great stay !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a good hotel, but it is less quality than others Sofitel of Latam area. It has a very good relation between quality and price.
reviews.title: GOOD PLACE TO STAY

reviews.text: The front desk and bell boys were very kind with us and the room was clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The hotel is well located, beside de airport (complimentary transder every 30 minutes), Miami downown (20 minutes), Miami beach (30 minutes), Aventura mall (30 minutes), Dolphin mall (10 minutes and there is a transfer by paying $10) and Sawgrass Mills (40 minutes). All the times by car.
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Furthermore, we bought a couple of items of Amazon and we found the packages in our room when we came back at night that it showed us a good service. Apart of that, the WiFi is complimentary and the parking fee is $10.
reviews.title: Budget friendly, feels like a 5-star, and happens to be a mile or so away from the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything at this hotel should be highlighted. Everyone welcome you as an old friend and has to offer everything that your may need to make your stay better than anywhere else, even your own home! Room is cozy, amenities are luxurious, kitchen (restaurant and room service as well) five stars.
reviews.title: all you need for a night stop over in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel Miami airport pre cruise 3rd Nov 2007 this was recommened to us by our travel agent.
reviews.title: Felt like a Valued Guest

reviews.text: From being picked up at the airport Saturday afternoon to checking out Sunday lunch time staff could not do enough for us to make our stay feel special.
reviews.title: Really liked the Sofitel.......hated the inflated prices for food
Not Worth The Money
reviews.text: On arrival they apologised our room was not ready so they gave us a drinks voucher for the bar and looked after our luggage. We did not make it to the bar before a staff member advised us the room was ready and our luggage was on its way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Later in the evening we went down to the bar to use our drinks vouchers. Even though there was a wedding party in the bar area the bar tender acknowledged us and we were served very quickly. Another staff member found us a seat in the bar area and took our food order. I know it was only burger , fries cheesecake and coffee. But either it was the long flight from the UK or one of the best bar meals we have ever had,service was 1st class.
reviews.title: Simply....... WOW

reviews.text: Our room was very quiet and the bed was just heaven in the morning we had breakfast really good value. Hotel arranged for transport to the cruise port checkout smooth and they wished us a happy cruise.
reviews.title: Good stay

likes.disliked: — ants, musty smell in the lower level meeting rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for one night after coming back from a cruise. We pulled into port at 8:am Friday morning but checkin wasn't until 3:00pm. We took a chance and arrived at the hotel around 11:00am. Our room wasn't ready but the clerk offered to upgrade us to a business suite at no extra charge! I thought I already got a great deal for a regular room at $145/night but now I got a business suite worth $325. The staff was very accomodating and very helpful. The beds are very very comfortable. The pool with it's waterfall is really cool. The airport is only five minutes away and they provide free shuttle service. Since we didn't have a rental car, they provided a driver to drive us to a local restaurant at no charge. The one downside about the hotel that I can mention is the menu prices. I checked the restaurant menu and the entree's were very pricey, all $20+. So we ordered room service for a light meal. Two panini bread sandwichs with fries and a liter bottle of water: $42.00! By the pool we had two strawberry daquiris: $21.00! This did not include tips. But overall, I had a great stay and if I'm ever there again I'll use their shuttle service to a local restaurant.
reviews.title: Very nice but restaurant way overpriced.

likes.liked: — Staff, comfort, pool, proximity to airport, shuttle service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after being married & prior to cruising the next day for our honeymoon. It did result in a funny story to tell & all worked out well. When we arrived they checked us in, but upon getting to our room, found a half naked man just out of the shower! We went back to the front desk & explained, the man showed up & basically he had asked for a late check out at 2pm and they had cleaned the room thinking he had left, but he never did! Funny start to our newly married life, but not their fault. They were very accomodating and gave us a much larger suite, many extra towels when we asked and a $100 certificate to the restaurant. We found the bed to be wonderfully relaxing & comfortable, the shower pressure was great, the meal in the restaurant was very upscale & delicious. No sounds from being near the airport at all! Overall, a great stay and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel Miami on May 13th, prior to a cruise leaving
reviews.title: Will never ever ever ever return!

reviews.text: from the Port of Miami.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

likes.disliked: — Rooms weren't ready on arrival in the evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately our bags were lost by the airline, so we didn't have any toiletries (e.g. razor, deodorant, etc). We asked the front desk if the could provide us with these items, just for the night. Instead
reviews.title: Will NOT Return

reviews.text: I've always experienced high quaility at all Sofitels I've stayed at worldwide. This one falls way below the bar. The front desk was good, the public areas okay but my room was so dated I was sorry I recommended this property to several of my friends. We just needed a short stay prior to our late night flight to Rio. The only good thing was the rate, its proximity to the airport and their comp shuttle Even though the room appeared clean, the carpet was worn and the furniture was in desperate need of upgrading. Never again.
reviews.title: Not of Sofitel Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During a recent visit to Miami, my wife and I decided to stay at the Sofitel after reading such great reviews. Check-in services, concierge, and valet were top notch. The warm welcome and personal attention was beyond comparison. Personally, I had never felt so specially welcomed ever before. The room was very nice overlooking the city and airport (never heard a single plane). Wireless internet was fast and free. We enjoyed a few glasses of wine and some of the best cheeses they may import. Overlooking the Blue Lagoon, Sofitel sits behind a guarded gate offering privacy and security. Sofitel helped make our Miami visit an excellent and memorable experience. Next time I’ll make sure to use the gym.
reviews.title: Simply Love Sofitel

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel for three nights when going back home to St. Kitts. The trip started out rocky but the hotel, service, food and staff made the rough experience at the airport fade away. The receptionist was very engaging and looked me in the eye when talking. Love that. After learning about the mishap with the shuttle, they offered some treat for my boys. They loved them. The room service and restaurant food were of a very high quality. They even portioned out the meal into two as I asked for my sons to share the entrees. The cleaner made the room very comfortable. She even organised my toiletries I left on the sink. Nice touch. The beds were very comfy and sheets luxurious. Sleep was more than restful. On departure, even the bellman added the touch with showing us a picture of his son. My first stay at this hotel, my only hotel now in Miami.
reviews.title: Professional, attentive, friendly

reviews.text: It was my first time in Miami and the hotel and the staff made it an exceptional stay. Right from the door being opened, to getting an upgrade on my room, the pool, the free appetizers, down to my clothes being folded and organized while I was out. The maid actually folded and arranged my clothes and make-up!! That's exceptional! If you stay here be sure to get a room on the end facing the bay with an extra window at the side. You can watch the planes take off, see the people in the pool below you and all of miami on either side of your room. Fantastic! Stay on a high floor if possible; makes the experience even more riveting! It's just been remodled as well, so it looks amazing.
reviews.title: SOFITEL IS THE BEST PLACE TO SAY IN MIAMI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our concierge was exceptional and set us up with a driver so that we didn't have to depend on unreliable taxis and the overcharging. He even told us where to eat and hang out on Saturday night and he was right, we had an awesome time!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for a romantic weekend getaway

reviews.text: I enjoyed my recent stay at the Sofitel Miami and would highly recommend the hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Near Miami Airport

reviews.text: The hotel does not appear to have been recently renovated, however it is immaculately maintained. Our guest room was very clean and the public spaces were perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I was very impressed with the level of service from the hotel staff. The front desk staff was very polite, efficient and knowedgeable. The bell staff were very helpful and attentive. The housekeeping staff were always pleasant and ready to make our stay more comfortable.
reviews.title: Great hotel near MIA

reviews.text: We did not dine at the hotel but saw they have a very nice restaurant and bar. They also have a beautiful pool area with waterfall overlooking a lake.
reviews.title: Warm, and wonderful

reviews.text: As we booked an airport hotel we were not expecting a lot. But after taking the shuttle bus to the hotel and painless checking in, I was very surprised with the size of the room. Our rooms were a lot nicer than we expected them to be for what we were paying. There was plently of space in the rooms to leave luggage lying around, an extra bed and a cot without much trouble. In comparison with other 4 star hotels this was therefore a bonus. Although there was no fridge in our rooms, when we asked for it ( for medical reasons and for storing babyfood) a minifridge was delivered without any questions asked.
reviews.title: pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids loved the pool and it was very pleasant to sit by the pool for the adults too.
reviews.title: Favourite hotel I have ever been to!

reviews.text: The hotel did get busy with airline staff and cruisers at some point, but neverfelt overcrowded.
reviews.title: Good Value - - Needs Some Updating

reviews.text: Free internet access for guests in the lobby was very useful and the computers were usually available.
reviews.title: Disgusting

reviews.text: Even when sitting outside, I can't remember that we were bothered by the noise of airplanes, so I guess that only some rooms have problems with their windows. Mind you, we do live in London and are therefore used to airplane noise living under numerous flightpaths.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — Could hear the planes taking off from the airport.

reviews.text: We stayed one night on our way to the Caribbean and one night on our way back the first week of April '06. We paid $65/night for each stay, thanks to Priceline.
reviews.title: Decent for a one-night stay

reviews.text: The Sofitel has a free shuttle to/from the airport. It leaves the hotel every half-hour on the hour. We landed in Miami around 11pm (our flight was delayed). We didn't feel like waiting for the shuttle (we had our 4-year-old with us and it had been a long day), so we took a taxi. Cost: $16 (not including tip).
reviews.title: Not what we expected
Will go again
reviews.text: There was one gentleman at the front desk and no line. He was on the phone with what sounded to me like a hotel customer. He said he'd help me in a bit. Meantime, another couple arrived and the concierge said she would check them in. I internally debated whether I should say we were here first but decided to just let it go. I believe that because I chose not to make a big deal about it and said it was okay when the guy apologized for the delay, he upgraded us to a suite on the 5th floor, King bed and non-smoking. He really didn't have to do that and I certainly was not expecting him to, so that was a really nice surprise.
We've stayed in a standard room at this hotel in the past and the suite was definitely an improvement, although at the end of the day this is still just an airport hotel.
reviews.title: European elegance at an affordable price

reviews.text: The suite has a sitting room with 2 sofas, table, tv, desk and 2 chairs. The bedroom was a bit on the small side. The bathroom is what you'd find in any standard room.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The total experience was average.
reviews.title: Nice stay
The hotel offers anything you need for a relaxed stop over
reviews.text: This hotel shares excellent French unique atmosphere and great service with very old infrastructure which was renovated without dealing with the basic problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a very bad smell and the stay was difficult.
reviews.title: Close to the airport

reviews.text: The hotel advantages are:
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Proximity to the airport with a shuttle service (which we didn't use)
reviews.title: Disappointing rooms for a Sofitel
Good - But Not Great
reviews.text: The room was nice, lobby and check-in pretty good and bed was very comfy. Pleasant surroundings overall. However - the walls are very thin. I could hear everything in the hallway. When soors slammed, my bed shook. And yes, you are at the airport. So you will hear the occasional plane rumbling nearby. The location is pretty good. I'd give this place about a B.
Travelling to Miami for work, practicality usually wins over and I end up staying near in the Airport vicinity. However, the Sofitel makes up for this in leaps and bounds.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: It is in a standalone building with a large carpark and easy access. The rooms are very nicely furnised. Service is excellent with good amenities.
reviews.title: Sofitel Miami Style

likes.liked: — Clean stylish suite with nice view & great amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my last stay in mid August it was about 10pm and my TV wasn't working. They called out the Maitenance manager who gave it a quick look then said it would be easier to move to a room two doors down, if I would like. He arranged everything and had the new keys delivered and wiped the cost of the room service dinner I had had to cover the inconvience. Top marks!!!!
reviews.title: New favorite!

reviews.text: I also had the pleasure of spending some time in the pool which was very enjoyable and the bartender (during the day) in the downstairs bar was a great assett to the hotel. Again top marks.
reviews.title: Great 1 night stay at the Sofitel

description: In a setting like a tropical paradise, Sofitel Miami is only 5 minutes from Miami International Airport, 15 minutes from the nearest beach and 10 minutes from the Port of Miami. In addition, it's an easy drive to a number of major attractions. Overlooking a peaceful blue lagoon, the hotel features an exquisitely decorated lobby in which striking tropical colors are paired with Art Deco design and sculpture. The overall effect is one of contemporary French ambiance, comfortable yet captivating.
